fields.headline: Emin's flight of fancy
fields.bodyText: To the uninitiated, it looks a bit like a starling perched on top of a scaffolding pole. But it is actually Tracey Emin's first piece of public art, in Liverpool, commissioned as part of the north-west region's art05 celebrations. It will be unveiled today outside the Oratory, John Foster's miniature Greek temple next to the Anglican cathedral. Roman Standard features a small bird perched on a four-metre bronze pole designed as a tribute to the city's famous, mythical Liver Bird. "It vaguely resembles a swift," said Emin yesterday as the sculpture was installed. "But then it could be a starling."
